derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent. (as an adjective in the sense 'feeble'): from obsolete French, in Old French fieble (see feeble). Both noun senses also formerly occurred as senses of the word feeble and all date from the 17th cent

entry.tran: 小怪癖;(性格上无伤大雅的)缺点
entry.def: A foible is a habit or characteristic that someone has which is considered rather strange, foolish, or bad but which is also considered unimportant.

means.word_mean: 1. a behavioral attribute that is distinctive and peculiar to an individual
2. the weaker part of a sword's blade from the forte to the tip
